metadata.feature_description: Configure template-specific settings like name, description, keywords, and URL

steps.action: Navigate to Manage > Templates in PersonaBar
steps.expected: Templates management page should display with list of templates
steps.actual: Templates page displays with message 'You must save an existing page as a template prior to create a new template' - no templates exist

steps.action: Navigate to Pages and attempt to save existing page as template
steps.expected: Should be able to create a template from existing page
steps.actual: Server returns 400 Bad Request error when attempting to save template

issues: Cannot edit template name because template creation fails with 400 Bad Request error
No existing templates available to test editing functionality

steps.action: Attempt to create template with description to test editing
steps.expected: Template should be created successfully with description
steps.actual: Template creation fails with server error before description can be tested

issues: Cannot test description editing due to template creation failure

steps.action: Attempt to access template settings to set keywords
steps.expected: Should be able to access template settings and set keywords
steps.actual: No templates exist and template creation fails - cannot access settings panel

issues: Keywords field is not visible in the template creation form (only Name and Description fields shown)
Template creation fails preventing access to template settings

steps.action: Attempt to create template to test duplicate name validation
steps.expected: Should be able to create template and then test duplicate name validation
steps.actual: Cannot test duplicate validation because first template creation fails

issues: Cannot test duplicate name validation because no templates can be created due to server errors

steps.action: Fill in template name and description fields
steps.actual: Server returns 400 Bad Request when clicking Save button

issues: Save operation fails with HTTP 400 Bad Request error

steps.action: Clear the Template Name field (required field)
steps.expected: Save button should be disabled and validation should prevent submission
steps.actual: Save button correctly becomes disabled when Template Name field is empty, and field shows red border indicating required validation

observations: The Template Page Settings feature requires existing templates to test most functionality
Template creation via 'Save Page Template > Evoq Page Template' is failing with server errors (HTTP 500 and 400)
The template creation form only shows Template Name and Description fields - Keywords field mentioned in feature description is not visible in the UI
Client-side validation for required fields (Template Name) is working correctly - Save button is disabled when name is empty
The code in TemplatesController.cs shows SavePageDetails API which validates settings including name, description, keywords, but the API is returning errors
The templatesCreateManager.js shows validation rules including script tag detection (hasScript) and required template selection
